timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                return i -> (R) i; // Compliant, 'R.class::cast' wont compile.
          
          
            
                return i -> (R) i; // Compliant, 'R.class::cast' won't compile.
timeline.author: margarita-nedzelska-sonarsource

timeline.bodyText:
There is no such thing as an IdentifierTree not being an IdentifierTreeImpl, so the first test is useless.
Now, I'm afraid I don't understand what you try to achieve here.
Testing if we are in the presence of a raw type of a generic type? For instance (List) obj ?
Whatever it is, we have a way to express this through our own API rather than relying on the toString() of the eclipse binding.
timeline.author: m-g-sonar

replies.author: margarita-nedzelska-sonarsource

replies.bodyText:
So I think this method should help:
https://github.com/SonarSource/sonar-java/blob/master/java-frontend/src/main/java/org/sonar/java/model/JUtils.java#L94
Which would make:
return JUtils.isTypeVar(identiferTree.symbolType());
replies.author: m-g-sonar
